tasks.task: Determine the time and depth of water infiltration during furrow irrigation, considering advance time, recession time, and application efficiency.
subtasks: Calculate the net time requirement (Tn) using the modified infiltration equation.
Determine the advance time (TT) required for water to reach the downstream end of the furrow.
Compute the cutoff time (TCO) by combining the net time requirement, advance time, and recession time.
Calculate the average infiltration opportunity time (TO) for the entire furrow length.
Determine the gross depth of water application (YG) considering the stream size and cutoff time.
Evaluate the distribution pattern efficiency (YD/YG * 100) to assess water application uniformity.
Calculate the equivalent depth of surface runoff (DRO) by subtracting the average infiltration depth from the gross depth.
Determine the depth of deep percolation by subtracting the net irrigation depth from the average infiltration depth.

tasks.task: Analyze the impact of a cutback system on water application efficiency.
subtasks: Adjust the stream size midway through irrigation (from Q1 to Q2, e.g., Q2 = 0.5 * Q1).
Modify the adjusted weighted parameter (P) and net infiltration time (Tn) to account for the cutback.
Recalculate the average infiltration opportunity time considering both the pre-cutback and post-cutback periods.
Assess the reduction in surface runoff and deep percolation through the cutback system.
Compare distribution pattern efficiency before and after implementing the cutback system.
